VIII. The Scholastics.

These theologians generally did little toward defining and de- veloping the idea. of inspiration. For the most part they accepted the traditional doctrine, assumed it as a first principle admitted by all, and made it a basis for further theological investigation. There seemed to be no need of proving, explaining or applying that which was unquestioned in the church.
